title: Web Development Practical Competency Enhancement: Instructional Design Based on APOS Theory for Least Squares Estimation Understanding

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary statistical concepts (mean, variance), linear function comprehension, and ability to perform simple algebraic transformations
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can explain the fundamental principles of least squares estimation through APOS theory's four stages (action-process-object-schema)

Learners can demonstrate the process of transforming statistical problems into deterministic linear functions from probabilistic problems by connecting various mathematical representations (graphs, matrices, algebraic expressions)

Learners can explain the relationship between the geometric meaning (minimizing residual sum of squares) and algebraic representation (differentiation of error sum of squares) of the least squares method

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
